snippet: A survey from Markit Economics of purchasing managers showed that the bloc’s output barely edged up this month in both services and manufacturing.
abstract: Private sector report from Markit Economics finds that composite ouput index for the eurozone slipped to 52.8 in August from 53.8 in July; figures show that while region's continued economic expansion is only slightly better than outright stagnation.
lead_paragraph: A survey from Markit Economics of purchasing managers showed that the bloc’s output barely edged up this month in both services and manufacturing.

headline.main: Fresh Data Reflect Anemic Growth in Eurozone
headline.print_headline: Hiring Weak as Eurozone Economic Expansion Slows to Crawl, Survey Shows
